alert.note: Alert for Ashland (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 07 at 2:40PM EST until March 08 at 1:12AM EST by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of north central Ohio, including the following county, Ashland. * WHEN...Until 515 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 239 PM EST, gauge reports indicated an area of very heavy rainfall across the warned area. Between 1 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - At 1:45 PM the river gauge on the Black Fork in Loudonville was at 10.1 feet which is in minor flood. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Loudonville. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
